body:
I just noticed this bug in my own code's doc as well.

Out of curiosity, why is a function that is not a method assigned to any type at all?  i.e., why is it indented under a type in the generated "Index" section of the doc?  I've often found this confusing when looking at, for example, the "time" docs. I guess I see the idea behind it (to group potentially-related functions together?) but it's counter-intuitive insofar as the function doesn't really "belong" to that type so when I go looking for time.Parse I ddidn't expect to have to look under the time.Time section.

And of course it has the drawback expressed by this bug, where choosing one of several types or moving it to top-level will be inconsistent.
